title: XORPD â€” Bitwise Logical XOR of Packed Double Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`XORPD xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VXORPD xmm1,xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VXORPD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VXORPD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VXORPD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VXORPD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs a bitwise logical XOR of the two, four or eight packed double-precision floating-point values from the first source operand and the second source operand, and stores the result in the destination operand

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.512 encoded version: The first source operand is a ZMM register. The second source operand can be a ZMM register or a vector memory location. The destination operand is a ZMM register conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 and EVEX.256 encoded versions: The first source operand is a YMM register. The second source operand is a YMM register or a 256-bit memory location. The destination operand is a YMM register (conditionally updated with writemask k1 in case of EVEX). The upper bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding ZMM register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 and EVEX.128 encoded versions: The first source operand is an XMM register. The second source operand is an XMM register or 128-bit memory location. The destination operand is an XMM register (conditionally updated with writemask k1 in case of EVEX). The upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding ZMM register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: The second source can be an XMM register or an 128-bit memory location. The destination is not distinct from the first source XMM register and the upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding register destination are unmodified.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
